PARAGRAPH.STRING: , also known as Changbai Mountain in China, is a volcanic mountain on the border between China and North Korea, located at 42°00'24N,128°03'18E. At 2,744 m,
is the highest mountain of the Changbai mountain range to the north and Baekdudaegan mountain range to the south.
is also the highest mountain in Korea and Manchuria.

The Korean name, Baekdu-san, means "white-headed mountain". The Chinese name, Changbai Shan and the Manchu name, Golmin Aanggiyan Alin mean "perpetually white mountain". English-language volcanology resources often refer to
One of the highest crater lakes in the world, called Heaven Lake ([] ), lies at the top of
